sentences.en: A blur of sunlight was crawling across his hair.
sentences.cn: 一道耀眼的阳光正抹过他的头发.

sentences.en: A wicked, mordant sense of humour has come to the fore in Blur's world.
sentences.cn: 布勒的世界里已出现了一种恶意、刻薄的幽默感。

sentences.en: But we see it only as a hazy blur.
sentences.cn: 但我们看到的只是模糊的斑点.

sentences.en: C iscreated using the noise filter and vertical motion blur.
sentences.cn: C的创建是由杂点滤镜和垂直运动滤镜模糊制作的.

sentences.en: Color fringes appear that tend to blur the outlines of images.
sentences.cn: 颜色条纹会使映像的轮廓模糊不清.

sentences.en: Do drunkards blur reality, or come closer to it?
sentences.cn: 酒醉之后是使现实模糊不清, 还是更加接近现实了 呢 ?

sentences.en: Everything becomes a blur when you travel beyond a certain speed.
sentences.cn: 当你超过一定的速度行进时,一切都变得模模糊糊的.

sentences.en: His arm was a rapid blur of movement as he struck.
sentences.cn: 他出击时胳膊快速一晃，令人眼花缭乱。

sentences.en: If you move your eyes and your head, the picture will blur.
sentences.cn: 如果你的眼睛或头动了，图像就会变得模糊不清。

sentences.en: Many of the details in the picture are blurred.
sentences.cn: 照片中的许多细节部分都模糊了。

sentences.en: My memory of the accident is only a blur.
sentences.cn: 我对那次事故的记忆模糊不清.

sentences.en: Out of the corner of my eye I saw a blur of movement on the other side of the glass.
sentences.cn: 从眼角余光中我看到玻璃的另一边隐约有东西在移动。

sentences.en: Should the object come closer than this near point, the image will blur.
sentences.cn: 如果物体比这个近点更近, 那么图象就会模糊了.

sentences.en: The houses appeared as a blur in the mist.
sentences.cn: 房子在薄雾中隐隐约约看不清.

sentences.en: The island was a blur through misty rain.
sentences.cn: 小岛在蒙蒙烟雨中影影绰绰。

sentences.en: The racing cars passed in a blur.
sentences.cn: 竞赛的汽车影绰不清地飞驰而过.

sentences.en: The street lights were blurred by the fog.
sentences.cn: 街灯在迷雾的笼罩下十分昏暗。

words.tran_cn: 模糊的；污脏的；不清楚的
玷污；使…模糊不清；使感觉迟钝（blur的过去式和过去分词）

phrases.tran_cn: 高斯模糊（一种滤镜功能）
运动模糊；动态模糊；动感模糊

trans.tran_en: a shape that you cannot see clearly

trans.tran_cn: （使）变得模糊不清，（使）看不清楚
trans.tran_en: to become difficult to see, or to make something difficult to see, because the edges are not clear
to become difficult to see, or to make something difficult to see, because the edges are not clear
